result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin D Curtis

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Defendant Justin D Curtis appeared by video from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video for Justin D Curtis.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21CF161, 22CF100.  Atty Raymond recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea to Ct 1 in 21CF161, Ct's 2/3 will be DRI as well as 22CF100.  

Court has colloquy with DE on his right to appear in person before the court, DE will waive personal appearance. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of G, finds DE guilty.  Sentencing argument entered by parties.  DE exercises his right to allocation, believes Drug Court will be a good thing for him.  DE has credit of 99 day in 21CF161 and 4 days in 22CF100.

Agreement calls for W/H sentence, 2 years probation, consecutive to Barron cases 17CF124, 17CF300, DE will pay CC/provide DNA/pay surcharge. DRI Ct's 2,3 and 22CF100.  So ordered by the court. Adj 11:07
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

4:12 PM Defendant Justin D Curtis not in court.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Justin D Curtis.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21CF161, 22CF100.  Per Atty Raymond DE is currently incarcerated in the Barron County Jail.  Atty asking for a plea date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Review hearing on October 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Review hearing on October 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

3:01 PM Defendant Justin D Curtis in court.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video for Justin D Curtis. Heard along with 22CF161, 22CF100.  22CF100-Waive reading of the Information, enter a plea of NG. Set for RH October 4, 2022 @ 4:00PM. Adj 3:02PM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Defendant Justin D Curtis in court.  Attorney Annette M Barna in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond appeared by video for Justin D Curtis. Heard along with 21CF161, 22CF100. 

22CF100-Waive reading of the CC.  DE will waive PH, court instructs on waiver of PH, DE understands, makes waiver knowingly, freely, voluntarily, court accepts waiver of PH. Court finds PC, will bind over for trial. Information to be filed within 30 days, set for arraignment. Set for July 25, 2022 @ 2:15PM, RH,Arraignment. 

Bond will be concurrent with 21CF161, Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  Adj 2:41PM
